wikipedia_page.main: Ceawlin Henry Laszlo Thynn, 8th Marquess of Bath (;  SOO-ə-lin; born 6 June 1974), styled Viscount Weymouth between 1992 and 2020, is a British businessman and the first son and second child of Alexander Thynn, 7th Marquess of Bath, and his wife, Anna Gyarmathy. He is active in a number of companies in the leisure, tourism, real estate, and financial services sectors.

link_mentions.page: List of marquesses in the peerages of Britain and Ireland

response: In 1641 Thynne's great-grandson Henry Frederick Thynne (1615–1680) was created a baronet in the Baronetage of England, (accessed 15 January 2008) and in 1682 his son, Sir Thomas Thynne, 2nd Baronet, was created Viscount Weymouth. In 1789, Thomas Thynne, 3rd Viscount Weymouth (1734–1796) became the first of the Marquesses of Bath,Thomas Thynne, 1st Marquess of Bath, in Encyclopædia Britannica Eleventh Edition (1910–1911) a line which continues to the present-day Ceawlin Thynn, 8th Marquess of Bath (born 1974).
